explanation: The report is correct. At function entry ldev is set to malloc(...) and the function returns immediately if that allocation fails, so when execution reaches the for_each_linux_driver loop ldev is guaranteed to be non-NULL. There is no assignment in this function that sets the local pointer ldev back to NULL, and a callee cannot change the caller's local pointer value. Therefore the inner conditional if (!ldev) will always be false and the allocation statement inside that branch is unreachable. This constitutes unreachable code (MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1).
